title: CACI optical terminals pass initial tests required for Space Development Agency satellites
summary: CACI International’s optical communication terminal passed initial ground tests required to compete for Space Development Agency satellite contracts, the company announced Sept. 18.

title: FAA seeks to wrap up Starship safety review in October
summary: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration’s commercial space transportation office says he believes that the FAA can wrap up safety reviews needed to update the SpaceX Starship launch license by the end of October, but than a concurrent environmental review is a “wild card” to that schedule.

title: Blue Origin preparing for New Glenn testing at LC-36 ahead of maiden flight
summary: Over the past few months, Blue Origin has continued making progress towards the maiden launch of its orbital class rocket, New Glenn. The company has continued testing systems at Launch Complex 36 (LC-36), and recently submitted plans for a refurbishment facility near the Cape Canaveral Skid Strip, expanding Blue Origin’s already impressive spread of installations on the Space Coast.

title: NB-IoT provider OQ Technology moves to next Arianespace Vega mission
summary: Launches for OQ Technology’s narrowband Internet of Things (NB-IoT) constellation are set to resume Oct. 4 after Arianespace moved the Luxembourg venture to its next Vega mission, instead of an upgraded version of the rocket that failed last year.

title: UARX Partners with Sener to Continue Development of OSSIE OTV
summary:
Spanish space transportation startup UARX Space has partnered with the multinational engineering and technology group Sener to assist with the development of the company’s OSSIE orbital transfer vehicle (OTV). OSSIE (Orbit Solutions to Simplify Injection and Exploration) is designed to be capable of performing a number of missions, including satellite delivery, debris removal, and in-orbit […]
The post UARX Partners with Sener to Continue Development of OSSIE OTV appeared first on European Spaceflight.
